sade incident report: During your flight on January 12th, 2025, it was observed that your drone (DRONE-XYZ-001) was operating during night hours without proper lighting equipment. Night operations require anti-collision lighting visible for at least 3 statute miles. Please explain why the incident occurred and any mitigations you have made or plan to make.
operator input: We acknowledge the violation. Our drone was equipped with standard navigation lights, but we failed to verify that they met the 3-mile visibility requirement for night operations. We have since upgraded all our drones with FAA-compliant anti-collision lighting systems (Strobon Cree Standalone) that are visible for 5 statute miles. All pilots have been retrained on night operation requirements, and we now perform pre-flight lighting checks before every night operation.

sade incident report: During your flight on March 14th, 2025, it was observed that your drone (DRONE-XYZ-001) came within 50 feet horizontally and 20 feet vertically of another operating drone in ZONE-001, constituting a Near Mid-Air Collision (NMAC). The minimum separation distance of 500 feet was violated. Please explain why the incident occurred and any mitigations you have made or plan to make.
operator input: We acknowledge this serious incident. The violation occurred due to a failure in our airspace awareness system. Our real-time airspace monitoring system experienced a brief communication delay, and our pilot did not receive timely alerts about the other drone's position. We have implemented the following mitigations: 1) Upgraded our airspace awareness system with redundant communication channels, 2) Installed automatic separation enforcement that triggers return-to-home if minimum separation cannot be maintained, 3) Enhanced pilot training on maintaining visual awareness and using backup systems, 4) Added mandatory pre-flight checks of airspace awareness system connectivity.

sade incident report: During your flight on April 22nd, 2025, it was observed that your drone (DRONE-XYZ-001) came within 75 feet horizontally and 15 feet vertically of another operating drone in ZONE-002, constituting a Near Mid-Air Collision (NMAC). The minimum separation distance of 500 feet was violated. Please explain why the incident occurred and any mitigations you have made or plan to make.
operator input: We are currently investigating this incident. Initial analysis suggests this may be related to the same airspace awareness system issues we addressed after the March incident. However, we want to conduct a thorough root cause analysis before implementing additional mitigations. We have temporarily suspended operations in high-traffic zones until our investigation is complete and new safeguards are in place.

sade incident report: During your flight on May 7th, 2025, it was observed that your drone (DRONE-XYZ-001) experienced a complete loss of Command and Control (C2) link for approximately 2 minutes while operating in ZONE-003. The drone activated its failsafe return-to-home protocol. Please explain why the incident occurred and any mitigations you have made or plan to make.
operator input: The C2 link loss was caused by interference from nearby radio transmission equipment that was not present during our pre-flight site survey. Our drone's failsafe systems functioned correctly and returned the aircraft safely. We have implemented the following mitigations: 1) Enhanced pre-flight site surveys that include RF spectrum analysis, 2) Upgraded our C2 systems with frequency-hopping spread spectrum technology to resist interference, 3) Added redundant C2 links on different frequency bands, 4) Implemented automatic frequency switching when interference is detected, 5) Enhanced pilot training on recognizing and responding to C2 link degradation.

sade incident report: During your flight on June 18th, 2025, it was observed that your drone (DRONE-XYZ-001) was operating during early morning hours (before sunrise) without proper anti-collision lighting visible for at least 3 statute miles. Night operations require compliant lighting equipment. Please explain why the incident occurred and any mitigations you have made or plan to make.
operator input: We acknowledge this violation. The flight was scheduled to begin at sunrise, but we began operations 15 minutes before official sunrise time. Our pre-flight checklist did not account for the precise timing of sunrise, and our pilot incorrectly assumed sufficient daylight. We are currently reviewing our procedures and will implement: 1) Mandatory verification of sunrise/sunset times before each flight, 2) Automatic lighting system activation based on GPS time and location, 3) Enhanced pilot training on night operation definitions and requirements.

sade incident report: During your flight on January 18th, 2026, it was observed that your drone (DRONE-XYZ-001) experienced a GPS signal loss and navigation system failure while operating in ZONE-001. The drone switched to visual line-of-sight manual control mode. Please explain why the incident occurred and any mitigations you have made or plan to make.
operator input: The GPS failure was caused by a software bug in our flight controller firmware that incorrectly processed weak GPS signals in an area with partial sky obstruction. Our pilot maintained visual line-of-sight and manual control throughout the incident. We have implemented the following mitigations: 1) Updated flight controller firmware to version 2.3.1 which includes improved GPS signal processing, 2) Added redundant GPS modules with independent processing, 3) Enhanced pre-flight GPS signal strength checks with minimum satellite count requirements, 4) Implemented automatic landing procedures when GPS signal quality degrades below safe thresholds, 5) Added pilot training on manual control procedures and GPS failure scenarios.
